column5: Saw the suckers running in the creek today so decided I would bring the boys on a walk (less then a block from my house) and see if we could get some.  They fought about who had the bigger branch, who would hold the worms, the little one (Karter) doesn't like to be helped by big brother (Alex).  Karter wanted to cross the road several times as we were fishing on a bridge and the suckers were running under it.  Anyways, we managed to get 2 on and landed one. Never measured it but probably around 17". Hook and worm.
haha. Isn't that the bridge just down the hill from your place?  Sweet!
Yep. They are running right through the city. Not a full run yet. Just starting.
I thought I recognized the bridge, but the houses are new. I used to love the sucker run in the bay 30 years ago.

Cut bait!  thanks for the invite.... as it turns out I'm the sucker for trying for inland 'bows again tonight. All I got was a canoe full of rain water. Man those inlanders are starting to piss me off.
All those new places are built on the old rail lands.
Where is this place? I would love to fish there this weekend.
See Nip... you gotta watch them backgrounds.. even for suckers!
I PM'd you. The creek runs right through the city.
Fantastic stuff Blair.....love the pics.  WTG Dad!   (PS...i took Jack to see the suckers running....he could care less....lol.)
Well, they could be fighting at home, or fighting at the river.  I'd take the river!
